##  1. Services

[ZeroMail](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Mail.ZeroNetwork.bit/) - Email over ZeroNet

[mail.zeroverse.bit](http://127.0.0.1:43110/mail.zeroverse.bit) - Another email service: more storage, supports ID providers ZeroID and ZeroVerse. Further info [here](/zeroblog.bit/?Post:52:explore+MAIL.zeroverse.bit)

[ZeroProxies](http://127.0.0.1:43110/14y3fN1A214HYdKe5f6WnQdfT3PdKLSAJo/) - Public ZeroNet proxies

# List of Zites: Discussion
### Zites that provide visitors with a means of social networking can be considered a discussion site.

**[ZeroTalk](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/).**  (English)  
Similar to Reddit, ZeroTalk is the original release of a social platform. The zite operates in a decentralized forum fashion containing topics & subtopics. Visitors who have registered with a ZeroID are able to post comments & replies. Visitors can edit or delete their own comment by clicking the small pencil icon found the to left of their post body & subject title.
  * Zite Address:   1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT  
  * Zite Discussion: 0List, ZeroCentral, ZeroTalk  
  * Zite Domain: Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit  
  * Zite Language: English, Various

### On The Issue Of ClearNet Links

Recently there have been articles edited and written to include links to relevant clearnet sites. However, there's no notice of which links point where without examining the target URL (which may not be possible or enabled in some browsers). Personally, I think there should be either an automatic marker for clearnet sites, or a notice on the article to alert users of what links leave ZeroNet. It's also worth noting that in the future, some users may be accessing ZeroNet without access to the traditional internet/web, making these essentially dead links. Thoughts?

*Thought*: I think we need to specify where the link will take the user, like **Bitcoin on the English Wikipedia**. That should be enough to explain what's going on. Also, the user can see the link if they hover it. ***muja@zeroid.bit***

*second thought*: clear phrasing is important, but it migth be better to use a simple icon to indicate clearnet sites. Something like a paperclip or Wikipedia's boxes-with-an-arrow icon would work. Here's more info: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:External_link_icons  
Using a different color might work too (e.g. a slightly lighter shade of blue), but not all monitors will be able display the difference.

*Third thought*: We really have three types of pages that articles can link to: other zerowiki articles, pages on other zites, and clearnet pages. That makes for two kinds of external links, the second one being 'more' external. We may or may not want to have different ways of handling those two.

Good points. I think both would help a lot but since there are three *kinds* of links, different colors would look better than different arrows.  ***muja@zeroid.bit***

There definitely needs to be a standardized way of linking to ZeroNet sites. Relative linking works, but it indeed absolutely breaks the chrome extension. The other option is to simply build the URL depending on what the visitor's current URL is. It's not a simple 'a' tag and requires a bit of javascript magic, but certainly works. Kaffiene does something like this.

### On The Issue Of ClearNet Links

Recently there have been articles edited and written to include links to relevant clearnet sites. However, there's no notice of which links point where without examining the target URL (which may not be possible or enabled in some browsers). Personally, I think there should be either an automatic marker for clearnet sites, or a notice on the article to alert users of what links leave ZeroNet. It's also worth noting that in the future, some users may be accessing ZeroNet without access to the traditional internet/web, making these essentially dead links. Thoughts?

*Thought*: I think we need to specify where the link will take the user, like **Bitcoin on the English Wikipedia**. That should be enough to explain what's going on. Also, the user can see the link if they hover it. ***muja@zeroid.bit***

*second thought*: clear phrasing is important, but it migth be better to use a simple icon to indicate clearnet sites. Something like a paperclip or Wikipedia's boxes-with-an-arrow icon would work. Here's more info: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:External_link_icons  
Using a different color might work too (e.g. a slightly lighter shade of blue), but not all monitors will be able display the difference.

*Third thought*: We really have three types of pages that articles can link to: other zerowiki articles, pages on other zites, and clearnet pages. That makes for two kinds of external links, the second one being 'more' external. We may or may not want to have different ways of handling those two.

Good points. I think both would help a lot but since there are three *kinds* of links, different colors would look better than different arrows.  ***muja@zeroid.bit***

# Welcome to ZeroWiki

[[ZeroWiki]] is a new publishing platform for [[ZeroNet]], the distributed web network based on Bittorrent, [[Bitcoin]] and Tornet.

ZeroWiki is public [[wiki]] software, and most of the pages in this site are editable. Anyone can modify, adding or improving content. See the [help page](http://127.0.0.1:43110/138R53t3ZW7KDfSfxVpWUsMXgwUnsDNXLP/?Help) to learn how it works.

Wikis can be used for taking notes, storing snippets, creating [[FAQ]]s and documentation, keeping track of your goals, or as a simple to-do list. 

Use it however you want! ZeroWiki is free and cloneable from your ZeroNet connected sites.

## [[List of Zites]]

## Testing

For testing please use the [[ZeroWiki:Sandbox]].  
If you would like an example of formatted text, please take a look at this [[ZeroWiki:Format]].
For a comprehensive guide of the markdown syntax supported by ZeroWiki, can view the guide [here](http://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/syntax#img).

### On The Issue Of ClearNet Links

Recently there have been articles edited and written to include links to relevant clearnet sites. However, there's no notice of which links point where without examining the target URL (which may not be possible or enabled in some browsers). Personally, I think there should be either an automatic marker for clearnet sites, or a notice on the article to alert users of what links leave ZeroNet. It's also worth noting that in the future, some users may be accessing ZeroNet without access to the traditional internet/web, making these essentially dead links. Thoughts?

*Thought*: I think we need to specify where the link will take the user, like **Bitcoin on the English Wikipedia**. That should be enough to explain what's going on. Also, the user can see the link if they hover it. ***muja@zeroid.bit***

*second thought*: clear phrasing is important, but it migth be better to use a simple icon to indicate clearnet sites. Something like a paperclip or Wikipedia's boxes-with-an-arrow icon would work. Here's more info: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:External_link_icons  
Using a different color might work too (e.g. a slightly lighter shade of blue), but not all monitors will be able display the difference.

*Third thought*: We really have three types of pages that articles can link to: other zerowiki articles, pages on other zites, and clearnet pages. That makes for two kinds of external links, the second one being 'more' external. We may or may not want to have different ways of handling those two.

Good points. I think both would help a lot but since there are three *kinds* of links, different colors would look better than different arrows.  ***muja@zeroid.bit***

# Welcome to ZeroWiki

[[ZeroWiki]] is a new publishing platform for [[ZeroNet]], the distributed web network based on Bittorrent, [[Bitcoin]] and Tornet.

ZeroWiki is public [[wiki]] software, and most of the pages in this site are editable. Anyone can modify, adding or improving content. See the [help page](http://127.0.0.1:43110/138R53t3ZW7KDfSfxVpWUsMXgwUnsDNXLP/?Help) to learn how it works.

Wikis can be used for taking notes, storing snippets, creating [[FAQ]]s and documentation, keeping track of your goals, or as a simple to-do list. 

Use it however you want! ZeroWiki is free and cloneable from your ZeroNet connected sites.

For testing please use the [[ZeroWiki:Sandbox]].  
If you would like an example of formatted text, please take a look at this [[ZeroWiki:Format]].

### Zites that provide media including movies, music, applications, books, can be considered media zites.

**[Microsoft MSDN Software Archive](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1AJB5rtjfB9imjDGVk5vtRtZp3zgYizbpG/).**  
This archive is a collection of MSDN Software taken from the Microsoft site, This zite uses Mega.nz links to provide content to visitors.  
  * Zite Address:   1AJB5rtjfB9imjDGVk5vtRtZp3zgYizbpG  
  * Zite Discussion: [0List](http://127.0.0.1:43110/0list.bit/?Topic:6_1BDapygZHNG8GxEuSsEpK9Xipm9mFfW1F2/isolinks+Official+Microsoft+MSDN+Software), ZeroCentral, ZeroTalk  
  * Zite Domain: n/a  

**[Play Torrents](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1PLAYgDQboKojowD3kwdb3CtWmWaokXvfp/).**  
Play Torrents is a zite that combines a beautiful user interface with move releases sourced from RARBG. The zite provides color coded ratings, movie trailers, and magnet links of various qualities. **Be aware that magnet links operate off of the peer-to-peer swarm and downloading media through this zite is just as easily monitored as The Pirate Bay**  
  * Zite Address:   1PLAYgDQboKojowD3kwdb3CtWmWaokXvfp  
  * Zite Discussion: 0List, ZeroCentral, ZeroTalk  
  * Zite Domain: playmovies.bit (unconfirmed)

**[Zero Torrents](http://127.0.0.1:43110/ZeroTorrent.bit/).**  
ZeroTorrent is a file-sharing zite that works off of the ZeroTalk platform. The zite allows any visitor with a ZeroID to publish links to magnet files, post comments, cast votes, and also provides categories and a search feature. **Be aware that magnet links operate off of the peer-to-peer swarm and downloading media through this zite is just as easily monitored as The Pirate Bay**  
  * Zite Address:   192dZ1EG5tU7PnCfuwGMDEBrr2eLqvs4t3  
  * Zite Discussion: [0List](http://127.0.0.1:43110/0list.bit/?Topic:44_1M5ztUWkCMP5Pv7MjwApWT7CNvWimGFaFa/ZeroTorrent), 
[ZeroCentral](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Dt7FR5aNLkqAjmosWh8cMWzJu633GYN6u/?Topic:3_1HcK5Hw1rPZeYdgTmqJGrVG2tSyR9Ke2Gt/ZeroTorrent), 
ZeroTalk

# List of Zites: Search Engines

**[Bwoi](http://127.0.0.1:43110/bwoi.bit/).**  
Bwoi is a search engine built with a beautiful user interface. Bwoi has the potential to provide search results from multiple sources.
  * Zite Address:   1f7FYxZWSZ5YG7Nd8sGsHcWEQgvdnVvQF  
  * Zite Discussion: 
[0List](http://127.0.0.1:43110/0list.bit/?Topic:1_19z3VucxwAoyQZwhmjEgA6vJ9TTp2GmGLN/Bwoi+Google+like+in+development+search+engine),

ZeroTalk,  
  * Zite Domain: 
bwoi.bit  

**[CensoredSearch](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LC3ryygCrv94ZK4Nk8ELW6vE1hKwopE8T/).**  
CensoredSearch is a search engine that uses an index of clearnet sites that allows visitors to use search terms of specific sites. The source of these sites have been gathered through various News sources so website blocking of specific sites can vary by region. The zite also provides a page that offers multiple ways to bypass website censorship efforts.  
  * Zite Address:   1LC3ryygCrv94ZK4Nk8ELW6vE1hKwopE8T

ZeroTalk,

censoredsearch.bit

# List of Zites: Services
### Sites that provide some sort of utility to the visitor can be classified as a 'Service' site

**[Nullpaste](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1MgHVPCE1ve6QfKrgsqCURzRj72HrRWioz/).**  
Nullpaste is a version of Pastebin for [[ZeroNet]]. The zite offers both public and private publishing, syntax highlighting, and the ability to view recent pastes.  
  * Zite Address:   1MgHVPCE1ve6QfKrgsqCURzRj72HrRWioz  
  * Zite Discussion: [0List](http://127.0.0.1:43110/0list.bit/?Topic:1_16Szsy1UtjiXpEevWVdUDrNfNTAZ9PLbcY/NullPaste+Decentralized+pastebin+with+code+highlighting+encryption), ZeroCentral  
  * Zite Domain: 0pastebin.bit (unconfirmed)  

**[ZeroID](http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroid.bit/).**  
ZeroID is used as an authentication service for username ID's Obtaining a alias from this service will allow visitors to post comments on the various zites available on Zeronet.
  * Zite Address:   1iD5ZQJMNXu43w1qLB8sfdHVKppVMduGz  
  * Zite Discussion: 0List, ZeroCentral  
  * Zite Domain: zeroid.bit  

**[ZeroMail](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Mail.ZeroNetwork.bit/).**  
ZeroMail is ZeroNet's version of a mail client. ZeroMail allows visitors with a registered ZeroID username to send encrypted messages to other users who have a ZeroID username. The ZeroMail system can not be used to send email to external email addresses.  
  * Zite Address:  	1MaiL5gfBM1cyb4a8e3iiL8L5gXmoAJu27  
  * Zite Discussion: 0List, ZeroCentral, [ZeroTalk](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:10_1MxdAjWgnqwCaunGHmhY39tVR51qV3peJL/ZeroMail+support+thread)  
  * Zite Domain: Mail.ZeroNetwork.bit  

**[ZeroPolls](http://127.0.0.1:43110/ZeroPolls.bit/).**  
ZeroPolls is a polling platform that allows visitors with an assigned ZeroID to post and vote on polls. Results can be viewed after a vote is submitted and comments can be posted by clicking on the poll's title. **Be advised that there is a small chance that an attacker could discover your votes associated with your ZeroID with a bit of effort.**  
  * Zite Address:   1K28kQFMquNzto2iQf4GGjr6oFUbC1NddE  
  * Zite Discussion: 
[0List](http://127.0.0.1:43110/0list.bit/?Topic:1_1Mk5sVKeCrwMc3wSD11jM7DZTiqF5D9BaD/ZeroPolls), 
[ZeroCentral](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Dt7FR5aNLkqAjmosWh8cMWzJu633GYN6u/?Topic:4_1PvAyLAB5H1JKbiFjx95ZJXrNJVyWxs5Hf/ZeroPolls), ZeroTalk  
  * Zite Domain: ZeroPolls.bit  

**[ZeroProxies](http://127.0.0.1:43110/14y3fN1A214HYdKe5f6WnQdfT3PdKLSAJo/).**  
ZeroProxies is a site that contains a list of Zeronet proxy sites. These proxy sites allows visitors of the regular internet to be able to view a ZeroNet zite without installing or running the Zeronet client engine. Due to the portal being provided by a proxy, functionality can be limited.  
  * Zite Address:   14y3fN1A214HYdKe5f6WnQdfT3PdKLSAJo  
  * Zite Discussion: 
0List, 
ZeroCentral, 
[ZeroTalk](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1_1ArMJqDaBJqeJ4MX3VqSnkfwkHe23PtLrW/Running+a+ZeroProxy)  
  * Zite Domain: 0proxy.bit, 0proxies.bit, zeroproxy.bit, zeroproxies.bit  

**[ZeroQuotes](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1NJyPoPpL8At17T6G7A1qHVQdqZDBmXcLT).**  
ZeroQuotes is a platform that features Quotes submitted by visitors. The site allows visitors to vote on the quotes that they enjoy.  
  * Zite Address:   1NJyPoPpL8At17T6G7A1qHVQdqZDBmXcLT

  * Zite Domain: n/a  

**[ZeroTODOs](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1B8LmXYHzMGZzcRWoidAQb5SmKSyfjN63f).**  
ZeroTODO's is a platform that allows visitors to create tasks and checklists and organize activity in a planner style.

**[ZeroVerse](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HPgDoReCFtE9qy71hnp55ksBVvV1gHJLQ).**
